segments.text: What is the best place to park ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: What vehicle do you usually bring to school ? Is it an automobile or a motorbike ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: OK . That means you can park in the student lot or on the street . Have you seen the handicapped spots ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I am not sure what a handicapped spot is .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Look for the blue signs and blue marked spaces . Do you usually park in the daytime or the evening ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Be careful about the time limits on the streets . Have you seen the signs for time limits ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: As long as you are careful reading the signs , you will always know how long you can park and what days are OK to park there . Are you aware of the curb colors ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: If you can remember that red means absolutely no parking and white means that you can only load and unload , you are going to be OK .
segments.speaker: S2
